text: Table 19-12. Select Attributes of the System.Xml.Serialization Namespace .NET Attribute ~ Meaning in Life [XmlAttribute] You can use this .NET attribute on a public field or property in a class to tell XmlSerializer to serialize the data as an XML attribute (rather than as a subelement). [XmlElement] The field or property will be serialized as an XML element named as you so choose. [Xm1Enum] This attribute provides the element name of an enumeration member. [Xm1Root] This attribute controls how the root element will be constructed (namespace and element name). [XmlText] The property or field will be serialized as XML text (i.e., the content between the start tag and the end tag of the root element). [Xm1Type] This attribute provides the name and namespace of the XML type.
